intro: Crataegus pentagyna var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth thorned hawthorn, is a shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and clusters of white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in woodland edges and open areas.
